name: Generate Images with Pollinations & Blog Articles with Gemini 2.5 from Telegram

user.name: Fahmi Oktafian
user.bio:
Hi! I‚Äôm Fahmi Oktafian, a developer and automation enthusiast with expertise in n8n, Node.js, and API integrations.

I specialize in building smart, scalable workflows ‚Äî from auto-publishing content to WordPress, sending automated Telegram notifications, to processing AI-based summaries and paraphrase.

I‚Äôm passionate about helping businesses save time, increase efficiency, and automate their digital processes with clean and user-friendly solutions.

description:
### This n8n workflow is a Telegram bot that allows users to either:

- Generate AI images using Pollinations API, or
- Generate blog articles using Gemini AI

### Users simply type image your prompt or blog your title, and the bot responds with either an AI-generated image or article.



## Who's it for
This template is ideal for:

- Content creators and marketers who want to generate visual and written content quickly

- Telegram bot developers looking for real-world AI integration
- Educators or students automating content workflows
- Anyone managing content pipelines using Google Sheets


## What it does / How it works
### Telegram Interaction

- Trigger Telegram Message: Listens for new messages or button clicks via Telegram

- Classify Telegram Input: JavaScript logic to classify input as /start, /help, normal text, or callback
- Switch Input Type: Directs the flow based on the classification

### Menu & Help

- Send Main Menu to User: Shows "Generate Image", "Blog Article", "Help" options

- Switch Callback Selection: Routes based on button pressed (image, blog, or help)

- Send Help Instructions: Sends markdown instructions on how to use the bot

### Input Validation
- Validate Command Format: Ensures input starts with image or blog

- Notify Invalid Input Format: If validation fails, informs user of correct format


### Image Generator
- Prompt User for Image Description
  ‚Üí When user clicks Generate Image

- Detect Text-Based Input Type
  ‚Üí Detects if text is image or blog

- Switch Text Command Type
  ‚Üí Directs whether to generate image or article

- Show Typing for Image Generation
  ‚Üí Sends "uploading photo..." typing status

- Build Image Generation URL
  ‚Üí Constructs Pollinations API image URL from prompt

- Download AI Image
 ‚Üí Makes HTTP request to get the image

- Send Image Result to Telegram
 ‚Üí Sends image to user via Telegram

- Log Image Prompt to Google Sheets
  ‚Üí Logs prompt, image URL, date, and user ID

- Upload Image to Google Drive
  ‚Üí Saves image to Google Drive folder


### Blog Article Generator
- Prompt User for Blog Title
‚Üí When user clicks Blog Article

- Store Blog Prompt
‚Üí Saves prompt for later use

- Log Blog Prompt to Google Sheets
‚Üí Writes title + user ID to Google Sheets

- Send Article Style Options
‚Üí Offers: Formal, Casual, or News style

- Store Selected Article Style
‚Üí Updates row with chosen style in Google Sheets

- Fetch Last User Prompt
‚Üí Finds the latest prompt submitted by this user

- Extract Last Blog Prompt
‚Üí Extracts row for use in AI request

- Gemini Chat Wrapper
‚Üí Handles input into LangChain node for AI processing

- Generate Article with Gemini
‚Üí Calls Gemini to create 3-paragraph blog post

- Parse Gemini Response
‚Üí Parses JSON string to extract title and content

- Send Article to Telegram
‚Üí Sends blog article result back to user

- Log Final Article to Google Sheets
‚Üí Updates row with final content and timestamp


## Requirements

- Telegram bot (via @BotFather)
- Pollinations API (free and public endpoint)
- Google Sheets & Drive (OAuth credential setup in n8n)
- Google Gemini / PaLM API key via LangChain
- Self-hosted or cloud n8n setup


## Setup Instructions

- Clone the workflow and import it into your n8n instance

- Set credentials:

  - Telegram API
  - Google Sheets OAuth
  - Google Drive OAuth
  - Gemini (via LangChain)

- Replace:

  - Sheet ID with your own Google Sheet
  - Folder ID on Google Drive
  - chat_id placeholders if needed (use expressions instead)

- Deploy and send /start in your Telegram bot


## üîß Customization Tips

- Edit the Gemini prompt to adjust article length or tone

- Add extra style buttons like "SEO", "Story", "Academic"

- Add image post-processing (e.g. compression, renaming)

- Add error catching logic (e.g. if Pollinations image fails)

- Store images with filenames based on timestamp/user



## Security Considerations

- Use n8n credentials for all tokens (Telegram, Gemini, Sheets, Drive)

- Never hardcode your token inside HTTP nodes

- Do not expose real Google Sheet or Drive links in shared version

- Use Set node to collect all editable variables (like folder ID, sheet name)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

nodes.name: Log Image Prompt to Google Sheets

parameters.text: ‚ùå Invalid format. Please use image your prompt or blog your title.

parameters.name: text
parameters.value:
=Welcome! Here's how to use this bot:

üñºÔ∏è /image
Type the command:  
`image of mountain scenery at sunrise`

üìù /blog 
Type the command:  
`blog What is MongoDB`

üßæ Format:
- Start with the keyword `image` or `blog`
- After that, write a description or title
- Without quotation marks

üìå Correct Example:
- `image of a futuristic house on a cloud`
- `blog How to Learn React Native for Beginners`

If you are still confused, type `/start` to open the main menu.

Thank you! üôå

Translated with DeepL.com (free version)

nodes.name: Log Blog Prompt to Google Sheets
Log Final Article to Google Sheets

parameters.content:
# Generate Images with Pollinations AI & Blog Articles with Gemini 2.5 from Telegram


This workflow is a multi-functional Telegram bot that allows users to generate:

 - üé® AI images using Pollinations API
 - üìù AI-written blog articles using [Gemini AI via LangChain]


It uses Google Sheets to log all user activities and Google Drive to store image assets.


## üì≤ Example Commands:
image a modern smart city at sunset  
blog The Benefits of Remote Work


## ‚úÖ Features:
  - Telegram Bot with menu buttons (/start)
  - Detects message type: /start, /help, button callbacks, or free text
  - Validates format (image ... or blog ...)
  - Auto-routes command to:
  - AI Image Generator
  - Blog Article Generator
  - Lets user choose article style: Formal, Casual, News
  - Sends real-time feedback: typing, uploading, error
  - Logs each entry to Google Sheets with timestamp
  - Uploads images to Google Drive folder


## üßæ Requirements:
  - Telegram Bot Token
  - Google Sheets OAuth credential
  - Google Drive OAuth credential
  - Google Gemini API (via LangChain)

## ‚öôÔ∏è Setup Instructions:
1. üîê Add Credentials to your n8n:

   - Telegram API
   - Google Sheets OAuth
   - Google Drive OAuth
   - Google Gemini (PaLM) via LangChain

2. üß© Update Variables:

   - Replace Google Sheet ID and Drive Folder ID
   - Make sure chat_id expressions are dynamic (avoid hardcoding)

3. üß™ Test Commands:

   - /start ‚Üí opens main menu
   - image your prompt ‚Üí generates image
   - blog your title ‚Üí asks for style ‚Üí generates article



## üîß Customization Tips:
1. ‚úçÔ∏è Modify Gemini prompt format in Generate Article with Gemini node
2. ‚ûï Add new style types like SEO, Story, Product Review
3. üñº Add more image models (e.g., Stability AI, DALL¬∑E)
4. üìä Add category/tags to Sheets for better reporting
5. üíæ Save responses with filenames using timestamps

## üîê Security Best Practices:
1. Do NOT hardcode API keys into HTTP nodes
2. Store all credentials via n8n credential manager
3. Avoid exposing actual Sheet/Drive URLs in public templates


## üèÅ Summary:
A powerful Telegram bot for content creators that lets users generate image assets and full-length articles ‚Äî without ever leaving the chat. Ideal for bloggers, designers, educators, marketers, and developers.


## üîó Want to Learn More?
üìö https://n8n.partnerlinks.io/l3i5p47vr7s2
üìö https://github.com/pollinations/pollinations
üìö https://aistudio.google.com/apikey

## üîÅ Google Sheets Integration (üìÑ Logging System)
This workflow uses Google Sheets as a central log for all user activities and generated content.

Each time a user sends a valid prompt (image or blog), a row is appended to the spreadsheet with relevant details.



## üìä Sheet Structure
The spreadsheet is expected to have one sheet (e.g. Sheet1) with the following columns:

| Column Name | Type     | Description                                                  |
| ----------- | -------- | ------------------------------------------------------------ |
| `Tanggal`   | `string` | Date and time of the request (`new Date().toLocaleString()`) |
| `Prompt`    | `string` | The user‚Äôs original prompt (image description or blog title) |
| `User ID`   | `string` | Telegram user ID (from message/chat context)                 |
| `Jenis`     | `string` | Type of generation: `"image"` or `"blog"`                    |
| `Hasil`     | `string` | For images: the image URL; for blogs: full content           |
| `Style`     | `string` | Writing style (only applicable for blog prompts)             |



## ‚úÖ What‚Äôs Logged?
For image prompts, it stores the image description, user ID, and image URL.

For blog prompts, it stores the blog title, selected writing style, and final article content.


## ‚öôÔ∏è Customizing Google Sheets for Other Use Cases
You can adapt the column names and fields for your own use. Here are suggestions:

üìå Add a ‚ÄúCategory‚Äù column if you want to tag prompts (e.g., ‚ÄúMarketing‚Äù, ‚ÄúTravel‚Äù, ‚ÄúNews‚Äù)

üìå Track response time by adding a Latency column using Date.now() logic

üìå Include sentiment or keyword analysis with custom AI nodes

üìå Use row_number to update specific entries if needed (already used in blog article flow)


To apply custom columns:

- Open Log Image Prompt to Google Sheets, Log Blog Prompt to Google Sheets, or Log Final Article to Google Sheets node

- Add new fields in the ‚ÄúColumns‚Äù > ‚ÄúValue‚Äù section

- Map expressions or variables from the current data flow

- Make sure your spreadsheet has matching headers to avoid errors.


## üìÅ Google Drive Upload (for image)
In addition to logging to Sheets, AI-generated images are uploaded to a designated Google Drive folder for archiving.

You can change the folder ID in the Upload Image to Google Drive node and optionally rename the file to include:

User ID
Prompt
Timestamp

Log Final Article to Google Sheets
